source.0e35fae7:
def land_area_distribution(data):
    mean=data['LandArea'].astype('float32').mean()
    others=0
    x=[]
#     country=[]
    for area in data['LandArea'].astype('float32'):
        if area<mean:
            others+=area
#           country.append(popn.index[popn['LandArea']==area])
#           print(popn.index[popn['LandArea']==area])
            data.drop(popn.index[popn['LandArea']==area])
            
        else:
#             country.append(popn.index[popn['LandArea']==area])
            x.append(area)
    country=[i for i in popn.index[popn.LandArea.astype('int')>=popn.LandArea.astype('int').mean()]]        
    x.append(others)
    country.append('Others')
    return x,country
area,country=land_area_distribution(popn)
source.c1044339:
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(14,8))
ax=plt.pie(x=area,explode=[0.02]*len(country),labels=country)
plt.title('Distribution of Countries by Land Area',{'fontsize':20},loc='center')
source.72a7083d:
#### The Above chart shows in most of the case, countries with high urban population tend to have low fertility rate. This may be because of:
-working and  busy people 

-high coordination between the couples

-easy access of contraceptive 

-people are conscious on population growth 

-expense of living is high.
